lines.gurmukhi: jYsy piRA Bytq ADwn inrmwn hoq bwNCq ibDwn Kwn pwn AgRBwig hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Pria Bhaytat Adhaan Niramaan Hota , Baanchhat Bidhaan Khaan Paan Agrabhaagi Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As a wife presents herself to her husband with humility and becomes pregnant, the husband brings her all the foods of her liking and taste.

lines.gurmukhi: jnmq suq Kwn pwn ko sMjmu krY suq ihq rs ks skl iqAwig hY
lines.transliteration_english: Janamat Sout Khaan Paan Ko Sanjamu Karai , Sout Hit Ras Kas Sakal Tiaagi Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: On birth of a son, she abstains from eating all that may be harmful to the child.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy gur crn srin kwmnw pujwie nwm inhkwm Dwm Anq n lwig hY
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Gur Charan Sarani Kaamanaa Pujaai , Naam Nihakaam Dhaam Anat N Laagi Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly taking the refuge of the True Guru with devotion; the desires of a Gursikh are fulfilled. He is blessed with the Naam by the True-Guru which is the source of desirelessness. One craves for nothing more and observes no rituals.

lines.gurmukhi: inis AMDkwr Bv swgr sMswr ibKY pMc qskr jIiq isK hI sujwig hY ]179]
lines.transliteration_english: Nisi Andhakaar Bhav Saagar Sansaar Bikhai , Panch Tasakar Jeeti Sikh Hee Sujaagi Hai ?179?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Sikh who has received the boon of elixir-like Naam can win over the five evils cautiously and swims across worldly ocean that is frightening like a dark night. (179)
